byline.contributor: Vanessa Piao contributed research from Beijing.

abstract: Ethnic Uighurs clash with authorities at checkpoint in Kashgar, city in China's Xinjiang region, resulting in deaths of 15 attackers and two police officers and seizure of firebombs and explosive devices; Beijing has taken 'strike hard' campaign against escalating attacks by Uighurs who are struggling for freedom and trying to form their own independent nation.
lead_paragraph: More than a dozen people were killed in the violence Monday, according to a Radio Free Asia report that was largely corroborated by local residents.

headline.main: Deadly Clash Between Police and Ethnic Uighurs Reported in Xinjiang Region of China
headline.print_headline: Deadly Clash in Western China Between Uighurs and the Police

snippet: More than a dozen people were killed in the violence Monday, according to a Radio Free Asia report that was largely corroborated by local residents.
